column2: Uskar) is a town in the Komi Republic
column4: located 757 kilometers (470 mi) east of the republic's capital city of Syktyvkar and 100 kilometers (62 mi) north of the town of Pechora
column5: on the northern bank of the Usa River
column6: 30 kilometers (19 mi) before its confluence with the Pechora River. Population: 40

column1: Usinsk was founded in 1966 as a settlement at the newly discovered deposits of petroleum in the north of the Komi Republic. Town status was granted to it in 1984.
Within the framework of administrative divisions
column3: together with the urban-type settlement of Parma and eighteen rural localities
column4: incorporated as the town of republic significance of Usinsk—an administrative unit with the status equal to that of the districts. As a municipal division
column5: the town of republic significance of Usinsk is incorporated as Usinsk Urban Okrug.

column1: The town is the center for the production of oil and gas in the Komi Republic. Three quarters of all the oil produced in the republic comes from the fields in the territory around Usinsk. In 1980
column2: the town was connected to the Pechora Railway by a 108-kilometer (67 mi) long sidetrack.
